thread.title: Potts Law Firm Expands its Roster of Impressive Trial Lawyers

author: cnbc.com
title: Potts Law Firm Expands its Roster of Impressive Trial Lawyers
text:
DALLAS, Feb. 6, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- Houston-based Potts Law Firm is opening its new office in Dallas today and adding two highly accomplished trial lawyers. The firm is expanding its practice to include areas such as complex commercial litigation and fraudulent transaction litigation.
Potts' Dallas location welcomes Partners Micah Dortch and Maryssa Simpson , formerly of Cooper and Scully. Christopher Lindstrom , also from Cooper and Scully, will be joining The Potts Law Firm in their Houston office as a Partner. Mr. Dortch has represented clients ranging from large national corporations to individuals who have suffered from various forms of catastrophic personal injuries. Mr. Dortch has appeared in the Texas Super Lawyers® Rising Stars® list in 2010, and again from 2012-2017. Maryssa Simpson has advocated for clients in both state and federal courts in Texas, and specializes in injury and commercial disputes. Christopher Lindstrom has a background in personal injury litigation and more recently focuses on recovering monies in bankruptcy disputes, breach of contract and product liability. Mr. Lindstrom has appeared in the Texas Super Lawyers® Rising Stars® list from 2009 – 2015.
"With the addition of Micah Dortch and his group from Cooper and Scully, we are not only entering the Dallas legal market but are benefitting from one of the up and coming stars of the Texas trial bar as evidenced by Mr. Dortch's recent $20 million verdict in Houston federal court," states Derek Potts , National Managing Partner for Potts Law Firm. "Our new Dallas office will allow our firm to continue expanding in the areas of complex plaintiffs' commercial litigation, mass torts, and catastrophic personal injury litigation in the fourth biggest metropolis in the United States."
About The Potts Law Firm:
The Potts Law Firm diligently pursues a variety of complex plaintiffs' matters including mass torts, catastrophic personal injury, commercial litigation and class actions nationwide. Derek Potts is regularly appointed by state and federal courts to lead some of the largest civil litigations in the United States. The Potts Law Firm has offices in Houston, Dallas, Kansas City, Albuquerque, Little Rock, and Orlando. More information can be found at: http://www.potts-law.com .
